entry.title: The astrocytic ensemble acts as a multiday trace to stabilize memory
entry.content:
The astrocytic ensemble acts as a multiday trace to stabilize memory

Emotional experience evokes signalling in astrocytes, which form an ensemble that is reinforced by secondary astrocytic state changes resulting from repeated experience, leading to memory stabilization.

  • Ken-ichi Dewa
  • Kodai Kaseda
  • Jun Nagai
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: A vaccine central in A(H5) influenza antigenic space confers broad immunity
entry.content:
A vaccine central in A(H5) influenza antigenic space confers broad immunity

A high-resolution antigenic map of influenza A(H5) haemagglutinin (HA) enables the design of immunogenic and antigenically central vaccine HA antigens that elicit antibody responses broadly covering the A(H5) antigenic space.

  • Adinda Kok
  • Samuel H. Wilks
  • Mathilde Richard
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Isolation, engineering and ecology of temperate phages from the human gut
entry.content:
Isolation, engineering and ecology of temperate phages from the human gut

Human host-associated cellular products may act as induction agents for bacteriophages.

  • Sofia Dahlman
  • Laura Avellaneda-Franco
  • Jeremy J. Barr
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Population-specific polygenic risk scores for people of Han Chinese ancestry
entry.content:
Population-specific polygenic risk scores for people of Han Chinese ancestry

The Taiwan Precision Medicine Initiative recruited and genotyped more than half a million Taiwanese participants, almost all of Han Chinese ancestry, and performed comprehensive genomic analyses and developed polygenic risk score prediction models for numerous health conditions.

  • Hung-Hsin Chen
  • Chien-Hsiun Chen
  • Cathy S. J. Fann
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: In-plane dielectric constant and conductivity of confined water
entry.content:
In-plane dielectric constant and conductivity of confined water

Scanning dielectric microscopy of nanocapillaries filled with water reveals that interfacial and strongly confined water exhibits a large in-plane dielectric constant and an in-plane conductivity approaching superionic values. 

  • R. Wang
  • M. Souilamas
  • L. Fumagalli
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Modern sea-level rise breaks 4,000-year stability in southeastern China
entry.content:
Modern sea-level rise breaks 4,000-year stability in southeastern China

Spatiotemporal hierarchical modelling of geological sea-level proxies and tide gauge data suggest that the modern global mean sea-level rise rate since 1900 has exceeded any century over at least the past four millennia, breaking the long-term stability observed in southeastern China.

  • Yucheng Lin
  • Robert E. Kopp
  • Yaze Zhang
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Patchy nanoparticles by atomic stencilling
entry.content:
Patchy nanoparticles by atomic stencilling

An atomic stencilling method based on the co-adsorption of iodide and 2-naphthalenethiol on gold is described, yielding more than 20 different types of nanoparticle with masked and painted regions and patchy particle morphologies not reported previously.

  • Ahyoung Kim
  • Chansong Kim
  • Qian Chen
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: A conserved H3K14ub-driven H3K9me3 for chromatin compartmentalization
entry.content:
A conserved H3K14ub-driven H3K9me3 for chromatin compartmentalization

G2E3-catalysed H3K14 mono-ubiquitination is crucial for SUV39H compartmentalization and H3K9 trimethylation in pericentromeric heterochromatin, which is essential for proper euchromatin organization and transcriptional regulation in mammalian cells.

  • Yuanyong Huang
  • Yimei Sun
  • Jiemin Wong
Article15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Integrated lithium niobate photonics for sub-ångström snapshot spectroscopy
entry.content:
Integrated lithium niobate photonics for sub-ångström snapshot spectroscopy

RAFAEL is a sub-ångström ultra-high-transmittance snapshot spectroscopic imaging sensor leveraging electro-optic reconfigurability in integrated lithium niobate photonics.

  • Zhiyang Yao
  • Shuyang Liu
  • Lu Fang
Article15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Aboveground biomass in Australian tropical forests now a net carbon source
entry.content:
Aboveground biomass in Australian tropical forests now a net carbon source

A transition from carbon sink to source for the aboveground woody biomass of moist tropical Australian forests has occurred, driven by increasingly extreme climate anomalies.

  • Hannah Carle
  • David Bauman
  • Patrick Meir
Article15 Oct 2025

entry.title: A long-necked early dinosaur from a newly discovered Upper Triassic basin in the Andes
entry.content:
A long-necked early dinosaur from a newly discovered Upper Triassic basin in the Andes

Discovery of a nearly complete skeleton of Huayracursor jaguensis, a Carnian dinosaur from the Northern Precordillera Basin in northwestern Argentina provides evidence of increased body size and early cervical elongation during the Late Triassic epoch.

  • E. Martín Hechenleitner
  • Agustín G. Martinelli
  • Julia B. Desojo
Article15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Niche-specific dermal macrophage loss promotes skin capillary ageing
entry.content:
Niche-specific dermal macrophage loss promotes skin capillary ageing

Capillary-associated macrophages are selectively lost over time, contributing to impaired vascular repair and reduced tissue perfusion in older mice.

  • Kailin R. Mesa
  • Kevin A. O’Connor
  • Dan R. Littman
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: New fossils reveal the hand of Paranthropus boisei
entry.content:
New fossils reveal the hand of Paranthropus boisei

Analyses of newly discovered hand and foot bones of a Paranthropus boisei specimen provide insight into possible tool use and other palaeobiology characteristics among Plio-Pleistocene hominin species.

  • Carrie S. Mongle
  • Caley M. Orr
  • Louise N. Leakey
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: From genotype to phenotype with 1,086 near telomere-to-telomere yeast genomes
entry.content:
From genotype to phenotype with 1,086 near telomere-to-telomere yeast genomes

A newly compiled atlas of species-wide structural variants and gene-based and graph pangenomes derived from highly complete assemblies of genomes from 1,086 natural isolates enable integrative genome-scale studies of Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

  • Victor Loegler
  • Pia Thiele
  • Joseph Schacherer
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Hijacking a bacterial ABC transporter for genetic code expansion
entry.content:
Hijacking a bacterial ABC transporter for genetic code expansion

Bacterial ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporters can be utilized and engineered to transport non-canonical amino acids into Escherichia coli for highly efficient synthesis of proteins with novel functions.

  • Tarun Iype
  • Maximilian Fottner
  • Kathrin Lang
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025

entry.title: Spatial metabolic gradients in the liver and small intestine
entry.content:
Spatial metabolic gradients in the liver and small intestine

Mapping of spatial metabolic gradients in the mouse liver and intestine identifies fructose-induced focal derangements in liver metabolism.

  • Laith Z. Samarah
  • Clover Zheng
  • Joshua D. Rabinowitz
ArticleOpen Access15 Oct 2025
